alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 23 at 11:54AM AKST until January 24 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN CONTINUE ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE THROUGH TUESDAY... .Snowfall continues across the northern panhandle with some pockets of freezing rain moving north through the daytime and evening on Tuesday as warmer air starts to arrive. Over the inner channels near Juneau, snow has become wetter but temperatures have remained cold enough to stay as snow. Precipitation rates will significantly diminish beginning Wednesday morning with a break through Thursday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Gustavus. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will become wetter. Freezing rain may mix in with snow through the evening, resulting in lower snowfall accumulation.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged check on their property. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
